Oceanic Solidarity Committee Formed 
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- An Oceanic Solidarity Committee for Peace and Reunification of Korea was inaugurated in Brisbane, Australia.
 The president of the Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange and the chairman of the New Zealand-DPRK Society were elected co-chairmen of the solidarity committee, the secretary general of the Wollongong Branch of the association vice-chairman of the committee and the national secretary general of the association its secretary general.

articles.title: Actions against Opening of Rice Market Unabated in S. Korea
articles.content:
Lao Vice-President Supports DPRK Policy 
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The Lao People's Democratic Republic sets store by its relations with the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
 Lao Vice-President Choummaly Saygnasone said this on Nov. 24 when receiving credentials from the DPRK ambassador to Laos.
 Noting that the friendly relations between the two countries are traditional and special ones provided and cultivated by President  Kim Il Sung and Kaysone Phomvihane, he said that Laos fully supports the DPRK in its line and policy and would continue to support them in the future, too.

articles.title: U.S. Wild Ambition to Dominate World under Fire
articles.content:
Actions against Opening of Rice Market Unabated in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- The Seoul District Federation of University Student Councils under the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils reportedly issued a statement on Nov. 23 in which it declared it would join the farmers in the struggle against the opening of the rice market.
 The statement deplored that farmers struggled to prevent the proposal on rice negotiations from passing through the "National Assembly" at the cost of their lives but what they have witnessed is only betrayal, tears of bitter grief and death of people standing at the edge of a cliff. 
 The opening of the rice market is not only an issue related to the farmers' existence but the issue on which our lives and sovereignty hinge, it noted, adding that the federation would actively solidarize with the farmers in their struggle.    
 Meanwhile, the chairman of the Pusan and South Kyongsang Provincial Organization of the south Korean Federation of Peasants Associations released a statement on Nov. 24 denouncing the police for their outrageous acts of insulting the farmers, who have struggled against the opening of the rice market, and covering up and distorting its atrocities.

articles.content:
Greetings to Chief of Palestinian National Authority 
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Mahmoud Abbas, chairman of the Executive Committee for the Palestinian Liberation Organization and chief of the Palestinian National Authority, on the occasion of the "Day of World Solidarity with the Palestinian People". 
 The message noted that the Palestinian people have achieved great success in their work for restoring their legitimate national rights including the right to set up an independent state in Kuds as its capital.    
 Reiterating the solidarity of the people of the DPRK with the Palestinian people's just cause, the message wholeheartedly wished him and the people of Palestine success in their work to find a fair solution to its issue.

Greetings to Albanian President
    Pyongyang, November 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Alfred Moisiu, president of Albania, on the occasion of the national day of Albania.
 The message expressed conviction that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms.
